Constructor Detail

Callvote

public Callvote()
Method Detail

processPrivateMessage

public void processPrivateMessage(Message m)
Votes can only be called in private. Check to see if the private message starts with callvote, and if so, call a vote if none is already in progress. Also, votes can be cast privately, so if it doesn't match, pass it along to see if it constitutes a vote.

Specified by:
processPrivateMessage in class Module

processChannelMessage

public void processChannelMessage(Message m)
This module only takes input from the channel if the vote is in progress.

Specified by:
processChannelMessage in class Module

processVote

public void processVote(Message m)
This function parses a message to determine whether it constitutes a vote or not. If it does, flag the user who cast the vote as having voted (in the hashmap) and if the message was sent in private, acknowledge the vote.

processOtherMessage

public void processOtherMessage(Message m)
Description copied from class: Module
Called when the bot receives a message which is not a PRIVMSG. Many modules may not need to override the default implementation, which does nothing.

Overrides:
processOtherMessage in class Module

startVote

public void startVote(java.lang.String starter)
Declare the vote as having begun (and reset the voting status flags)

endVoting

public void endVoting()
Count the votes and announce the results. I also check to see if the vote is of the form "kick ", and try to kick him is that is the case (and the vote is won) Note that the quorum of 3 people is necessary to prevent people being kicked while not paying attention.

run

public void run()
This thread is basically a timer, that sends messages every now and again encouraging people to vote. At the end of 60 seconds, end the voting.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable

hasVoted

public boolean hasVoted(java.lang.String who)
Check if a person has voted

setVoted

public void setVoted(java.lang.String who)
Flag a person as having voted.
